2133.subject: NURS
2133.descrlong: Use selected readings in genomic literature and its application in the aging adult population. Survey nursing theories that support the inclusion of genetics in human health and illness, providing a theoretical base for a discussion of the implications for pathophysiological changes in an aging population and the role of nursing in providing care. Use information technology to collect, organize and communicate patterns that support role of nursing in providing evidence based care.

2154.subject: NURS
2154.descrlong:
Offers students a foundational knowledge of genetics, genomics, epigenetics and environmental influences on health across the lifecourse.  This course includes ethical, legal, social and public policy implications in the genetic and total environmental influences on health and illness. Students will examine the ecological view of health and illness, the interaction of genetics, life events and environment and apply concepts to contemporary evidence based nursing practice.

(Restricted to NURS Majors Only)
